footer.tagline: Building a seamless, open ecosystem of machine learning data, models, and benchmarks—advancing AI openly for the benefit of humanity.

datasets.title: Datasets
datasets.subtitle: Explore thousands of machine learning datasets

hero.title: The Global Lab for Machine Learning Research
hero.description: Machine learning thrives on transparency. OpenML is the open, collaborative environment where scientists share FAIR data, organize experiments, and build upon state-of-the-art algorithms.
hero.trustedWorldwide: Trusted worldwide to benchmark algorithms objectively.

ecosystem.heading: Frictionless Integration
ecosystem.subtitle: Seamlessly import data and export experiments from your native scientific environment.

threePillars.title: The Three Pillars of OpenML
threePillars.subtitle: Open platform for sharing datasets, algorithms, and experiments to build a global machine learning repository

fairData.title: FAIR Data at Scale
fairData.description: Access thousands of uniformly formatted datasets. Every dataset is versioned, meta-tagged, and ready for immediate loading into your analysis pipeline.

objectiveEvaluation.title: Objective Evaluation
objectiveEvaluation.description: Stop guessing. Run your algorithms on standardized tasks with predefined train/test splits to ensure your results are comparable and peer-review ready.

frictionlessFlows.title: Frictionless ML Flows
frictionlessFlows.description: Treat experiments as objects. Share your model pipelines (flows) and results (runs) automatically to create a transparent scientific record.

accessibility.title: Accessibility & Integration
accessibility.subtitle: Use OpenML from the web UI, notebooks, or the command line—wherever you already work.

webInterface.title: The Web Interface
webInterface.description: Discover OpenML through an interactive web dashboard for exploring datasets and experiments.
features: Search, filter, and bookmark datasets by task type, size, and domain.
Inspect metadata, target variables, and distributions before you ever write code.
Compare versions, track provenance, and jump directly into related tasks, flows, and runs.
webInterface.summary: Browse, visualize, and organize everything from one place—ideal for exploratory analysis, teaching, and quick demos.

codeApis.title: The Code (APIs)
codeApis.description: Integrate directly into your code. Use our client libraries to programmatically download datasets, run tasks, and upload results without leaving your IDE.

benchmarking.title: Benchmarking Suites
benchmarking.subtitle: The Scientific Method for Rigorous Evaluation
benchmarking.description: Validate your models on curated benchmarking suites spanning domains such as healthcare, finance, and computer vision. Ensure your algorithm is robust across many datasets, not just a single benchmark.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.subtitle: The Problem
tasks.description: Standardized machine learning challenges with fixed evaluation metrics (AUC, RMSE, Accuracy). Each task provides predefined train/test splits to ensure your results are comparable and peer-review ready.

suites.title: Suits (or Suites)
suites.subtitle: The Collection
suites.description: Curated collections of tasks (e.g., "AutoML Benchmark," "Medical Diagnosis Suite") for comprehensive algorithm stress-testing across multiple datasets and problem domains.

workflowLoop.title: The OpenML Workflow Loop
workflowLoop.subtitle: Integrate OpenML into every step of your ML workflow.

import.title: Import
import.description: Load OpenML datasets in a single line of code, compatible with scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow, XGBoost, and more.

buildRun.title: Build & Run
buildRun.description: Train and evaluate models on those tasks using your favorite ML libraries. Try different pipelines and hyperparameters until you get results you are happy with.

export.title: Export & Publish
export.description: Automatically publish: Upload your workflows (flows), experiments (runs), and evaluation metrics back to OpenML so others can compare and reuse them.

knowledgeBase.title: Knowledge Base
knowledgeBase.subtitle: Contribute to the Global Knowledge Base
knowledgeBase.description: Generate persistent identifiers (DOIs) for your datasets, workflows, and experiments—ensuring FAIR compliance and enabling reproducible science.
knowledgeBase.citationDescription: Don't let your research die on a hard drive. Uploading to OpenML creates citable, versioned artifacts with provenance tracking. Your work becomes part of the global ML benchmark corpus, cited by peers and powering meta-research.

academicImpact.title: Contribute to the Global Knowledge Base
academicImpact.intro: Generate persistent identifiers (DOIs) for your datasets, workflows, and experiments—ensuring FAIR compliance and enabling reproducible science.
academicImpact.subtitle: The Citation Lifecycle
academicImpact.text: Don't let your research die on a hard drive. Uploading to OpenML creates citable, versioned artifacts with provenance tracking. Your work becomes part of the global ML benchmark corpus, cited by peers and powering meta-research.

faq.title: OpenML FAQ
faq.heading: Clear answers to the most important questions
faq.description: Whether you're training your first model or running large-scale benchmarks, OpenML streamlines every step of your workflow. This Q&A highlights what makes OpenML unique and how it can simplify your daily ML work.

questions.question: Why is OpenML ideal for ML research?
questions.answer: OpenML makes your experiments fully reproducible.
questions.footer: Anyone can repeat your results exactly.

questions.question: How does OpenML make results comparable?
questions.answer: All datasets and tasks are standardized. You can compare:
questions.footer: across identical evaluation protocols — essential for benchmarking.

questions.question: Can I search previous experiments?
questions.answer: Yes. Every experiment is logged with rich, machine-readable metadata. You can query things like:
details: "Which models work best on small tabular datasets?"
questions.footer: This makes OpenML powerful for meta-learning.

questions.question: What makes OpenML scientifically rigorous?
questions.footer: Ideal for academic papers, reproducible research, and ML competitions.

questions.question: How does OpenML make results comparable?
questions.answer: All results follow standardized evaluation protocols:
questions.footer: You can directly compare algorithms, pipelines, and hyperparameters at scale.

questions.question: Can I search previous experiments?
questions.answer: Yes. Every experiment is stored with machine-readable metadata:
questions.footer: You can query thousands of runs to discover what works best for your problem.

meta.title: About OpenML - Open Machine Learning Platform
meta.description: Learn about OpenML's mission to make machine learning simple, accessible, and collaborative. Join our community of researchers and practitioners building an open ecosystem of ML data, models, and benchmarks.

hero.title: About OpenML
hero.subtitle: Building a seamless, open ecosystem of machine learning data, models, and benchmarks — advancing AI openly for the benefit of all humanity.

meta.title: Contribute to OpenML - Join Our Community
meta.description: Help build the future of open machine learning. Contribute code, share datasets, improve documentation, or engage with our community. Every contribution makes a difference.

hero.title: Contribute to OpenML
hero.subtitle: Help us build the future of open machine learning. Whether you're a developer, researcher, or enthusiast, there are many ways to get involved and make an impact.

meta.title: OpenML Documentation - Getting Started Guide
meta.description: Learn how to use OpenML platform. Explore datasets, run experiments, share your work, and collaborate with the global machine learning community. Complete guides for Python, R, and Java.

hero.title: Documentation
hero.subtitle: Everything you need to get started with OpenML. Learn how to explore datasets, run experiments, and collaborate with the global ML community.

alert.title: Complete Documentation
alert.description: For comprehensive API references, tutorials, and advanced guides, visit our complete documentation at

meta.title: OpenML APIs - Python, R, Java & REST
meta.description: Access thousands of ML datasets, tasks, and experiments programmatically. Build reproducible machine learning pipelines with Python, R, Java, or our REST API.

api.title: OpenML APIs
api.subtitle: Access thousands of ML datasets, tasks, and experiments programmatically. Build reproducible machine learning pipelines with Python, R, Java, or our REST API.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: OpenML provides a unified interface to access machine learning resources across multiple programming languages. Whether you're exploring datasets, running experiments, or benchmarking algorithms, our APIs make it easy to integrate OpenML into your workflow.

datasets.title: 10,000+ Datasets
datasets.description: Access curated ML datasets with rich metadata

tasks.title: 50,000+ Tasks
tasks.description: Pre-defined ML tasks with standardized evaluation

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.alertDescription: Reading public data doesn't require authentication. However, to upload datasets, runs, or access private resources, you'll need an API key.
authentication.howToGet: How to get your API key:
authentication.step1: Create an account or sign in to OpenML
authentication.step3: Find your API key in the API section

datasets.title: Datasets
datasets.description: Datasets are the foundation of OpenML. They contain the actual data used for machine learning experiments.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.description: Tasks define a specific machine learning problem: which dataset to use, which target to predict, and how to evaluate.

flows.title: Flows
flows.description: Flows represent machine learning pipelines or algorithms. They describe the exact steps and parameters used.

runs.title: Runs
runs.description: Runs are the results of applying a flow to a task. They contain predictions, evaluations, and runtime information.

rateLimits.title: Rate Limits
rateLimits.description: To ensure fair usage, the API has rate limits:
rateLimits.note: If you need higher limits for research purposes, please contact us.

python.name: Python
python.description: The Python API provides the most comprehensive access to OpenML functionality, with full support for scikit-learn, PyTorch, and TensorFlow.

r.name: R
r.description: The R package integrates seamlessly with mlr3 and provides access to all OpenML resources.

java.name: Java
java.description: The Java API connector provides programmatic access to OpenML for JVM-based applications.

julia.name: Julia
julia.description: The Julia package provides high-performance access to OpenML datasets and tasks.

rest.name: REST API
rest.description: Access OpenML directly through our REST API for any programming language or environment.

meta.title: Meet Us - OpenML Hackathons & Events
meta.description: Join OpenML hackathons and community events. Meet the team, collaborate on open science projects, and help democratize machine learning.

hero.title: Let's Meet Up!
hero.subtitle: Join one of our hackathons and help shape the future of open machine learning

why.title: Changing the world requires focused, deep work
why.description: In hackathon-style events, we break away from routine and work for entire weeks on new ideas that push the scientific community forward. From building cool extensions of OpenML itself to solving data-driven problems in novel ways, we believe in open science and democratizing machine learning for everyone.

upcoming.title: Upcoming Events
upcoming.slackAlert: Join our Slack channel to stay updated and join the discussion!

sponsor.title: Sponsor an Event
sponsor.subtitle: Sponsoring can turn a great hackathon into an awesome one!
sponsor.description: We are always very happy with sponsorship to make the next hackathon even better. Sponsoring an event can be done through the OpenML Foundation and will be used directly for the benefit of the participants: to provide snacks, social activities, free stuff (e.g. t-shirts)...
sponsor.acknowledgment: We'd be happy to acknowledge your support on the OpenML website, and invite you to give a presentation at the event.

memories.title: Memories
memories.photoDescription: Check out pictures from previous events

cta.title: Ready to Join Us?
cta.description: Whether you're a seasoned ML expert or just getting started, our hackathons are the perfect place to learn, collaborate, and make an impact.

meta.title: Terms & Citation - OpenML
meta.description: Learn about OpenML's licenses, how to cite OpenML in your research, and our terms of use and privacy policy.

terms.title: Terms & Citation
terms.subtitle: Licenses, citations, and terms for using OpenML in your research and projects.

licenses.title: Licenses
licenses.description: OpenML supports multiple open licenses to maximize accessibility and reuse. Each dataset and resource on OpenML is tagged with its specific license.
licenses.ccby: Attribution required. Share and adapt freely with proper credit.
licenses.cc0: No rights reserved. Use freely without any restrictions.
licenses.bsd: For source code. Permissive license with minimal restrictions.

citation.title: How to Cite
citation.subtitle: Please cite OpenML if you use it in your research. It helps us demonstrate impact and continue development.

honorCode.title: Honor Code
honorCode.subtitle: Guidelines for ethical use of OpenML

items.cite: Give proper attribution and cite the original authors of datasets and papers
items.share: Share your contributions openly so others can build upon your work
items.respect: Respect dataset licenses and follow their terms
items.quality: Upload high-quality, well-documented data and experiments
items.feedback: Provide constructive feedback to help improve the platform

usageTerms.title: Usage Terms
usageTerms.subtitle: Rules governing the use of OpenML services
usageTerms.intro: By using OpenML, you agree to the following terms:

items.free: OpenML is free to use for research, education, and non-commercial purposes
items.api: API usage should follow reasonable rate limits to ensure fair access for all users
items.abuse: Automated scraping or abuse of services may result in access restrictions
items.warranty: Data and services are provided "as is" without warranty of any kind

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: How we handle your data
privacy.intro: We take your privacy seriously. Here's how we handle your information:

items.collect: We collect minimal personal information necessary to provide our services
items.usage: Usage data helps us improve OpenML and understand how it's being used
items.share: We do not sell or share your personal information with third parties
items.cookies: We use cookies for authentication and to improve your experience

contact.title: Questions?
contact.description: If you have questions about licenses, citation, or terms of use, please contact us.

meta.title: Dashboard - OpenML
meta.description: Your personal OpenML dashboard. Track your contributions, reputation, and impact on machine learning research.

dashboard.subtitle: OpenML is the place to share datasets, workflows, and collaborate on machine learning research.

focus.title: How to start: Choose a focus for today
focus.subtitle: Help us make relevant suggestions for you

signIn.title: Sign In - OpenML
signIn.description: Sign in to your OpenML account
signIn.subtitle: Sign in to your account or create a new one
signIn.error: An error occurred. Please try again.

codeDialog.title: Load Dataset: {name}
codeDialog.description: Use these code snippets to load this dataset in your preferred programming language

features.title: Features
features.description: Detailed information about each attribute in the dataset

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: How to cite this dataset in academic work

analysis.title: Data Visualizations
analysis.comingSoonDesc: Feature distributions, correlations, and data quality metrics will be displayed here.

tasks.title: Related Tasks
tasks.description: Machine learning tasks defined on this dataset
tasks.noTasks: No tasks have been defined yet

runs.title: ML Runs
runs.description: Machine learning experiments on this dataset
runs.noRuns: No runs have been recorded yet

collection.dialogDescription: Add "{name}" to one of your collections or create a new one.
collection.signInPrompt: Sign in to add datasets to your collections

report.dialogDescription: Help us improve OpenML by reporting issues with this dataset.
report.descriptionPlaceholder: Please describe the issue in detail...
report.emailHint: We'll use this to follow up if needed

deactivated.title: Dataset Deactivated
deactivated.message: This dataset has been deactivated and is no longer available.
